TextJPN: でかいあくびをひとつする。
TextENG: I let out a great big yawn.

TextJPN: ようやく寝付けた、と思ったらもう朝だったのだから…。
TextENG: It was like morning had arrived just as I got to sleep...

TextJPN: お袋が朝飯を並べながら、苦笑いしている。
TextENG: As Mom set up breakfast, she gave me a pained smile.

TextJPN: 「どうしたの圭一。@k@vS02/00/132700002.昨夜は何時に寝たの？」
TextENG: ``What's the matter, Keiichi?@k@vS02/00/132700002. What time did you go to sleep last night?``

TextJPN: 「１２時には寝たつもりだけど…、昨日は何だか寝つきが悪くてさ…」
TextENG: ``Well, I wanted to go to sleep at midnight... but I had some trouble with that...``

TextJPN: 「お祭りではしゃぎ過ぎて、興奮して眠れなかったんでしょう」
TextENG: ``You were probably all worked up from the festival.``

TextJPN: 「ち、違うよ…！　バリバリ！」
TextENG: ``N-No, that's not it...! Crunch crunch!``

TextJPN: 照れ隠しに、たくあんをバリバリと頬張る。
TextENG: I crunched down hard on the pickled radish to hide my embarrassment.

TextJPN: …昨夜の最後の最後で、詩音に聞かされた音の話。
TextENG: ...After all that happened yesterday, and our discussion about the sound Shion heard...

TextJPN: …何だかどこか遠くの板の間で、子供が跳ねてるような、ドタンバタンという音の話。
TextENG: ...That banging noise, like a child far away, jumping up and down on a wooden floor.

TextJPN: その話が嫌に頭にまとわりついて、なかなか眠れなかったのだ…。
TextENG: The story wouldn't get out of my head, so I had trouble sleeping...

TextJPN: 聞こえるはずもない、@kあるいは取るに足らないどこか遠くの小さな梢の音にまでびくびくした、…長い夜だった。
TextENG: It was a long night...@k ...and I kept jumping at the slight sounds of faraway tree branches, which should have been either unhearable or too insignificant to notice.

TextJPN: こうして朝の日差しと小鳥の声を聞いていると、それがいかに臆病なことだったのかよくわかるのだが…。
TextENG: When I woke up to the morning sunlight and birds chirping, it made me feel pretty ashamed about it, but...

TextJPN: …何となくすっきりしない朝だった。
TextENG: ...I felt far from refreshed this morning.

TextJPN: 「圭一く～ん、おっはよ～！」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kuuun! Good morning!``
``Huh?@k@vS02/02/130200073. Keiichi-kun, your eyes are all red!@k@vS02/02/130200074. Why is that? Why?``

TextJPN: 「おぅおはよう。@k@vS02/01/130100209.どういうわけか寝つきが悪くてな。@k@vS02/01/130100210.そんなわけで今日は寝不足だ。@k@vS02/01/130100211.…ふぁ～あ」
TextENG: ``Oh, hey, good morning.@k@vS02/01/130100209. I didn't get much sleep last night.@k@vS02/01/130100210. So I'm sleep deprived today.@k@vS02/01/130100211. ...*yaaawn*``

TextJPN: 「昨日のお祭りは楽しかったね…！@k@vS02/02/130200076.　レナも興奮がなかなか冷めなくて、なかなか寝れなかったんだよ。だよ！」
TextENG: ``The festival yesterday was a lot of fun...!@k@vS02/02/130200076. Rena's excitement took a long time to go to sleep, so I took a long time to go to sleep too! To sleep!``

TextJPN: レナの場合、まだ興奮が冷めてないようだな…。
TextENG: In Rena's case, her excitement seemed to still be wide awake...

TextJPN: 「こういうお祭りが何度もあればいいのにね！」
TextENG: ``They should have this kind of festival more often!``

TextJPN: 「またみんなで大盛り上がり。はぅ！」
TextENG: ``So we can have lots of fun together again. Hau!``

TextJPN: 「ん、あぁ、…そうだな」
TextENG: ``Mm, ah... Yeah.``

TextJPN: レナに昨日の祭りの話をされ、忘れかけていた昨夜のことを全て思い出す。
TextENG: Rena talking about the festival yesterday made me remember everything I had nearly forgotten from last night.

TextJPN: …祭具殿の中は、のんびりうららかな雛見沢の日常とはあまりにかけ離れていた。
TextENG: ...The inside of the ritual storehouse had been so utterly different from the relaxed, bright everyday life of Hinamizawa.

TextJPN: そして、鷹野さんにたっぷりと聞かされた様々な話…。
TextENG: All those stories that Takano-san told me, too...

TextJPN: 毎年、綿流しの日に起こる謎の事件。
TextENG: The mysterious incidents that occurred on the day of the Watanagashi Festival every year.

TextJPN: １人が死に、１人が消える奇怪な事件。
TextENG: The strange incidents where one person would die, and one would disappear.

TextJPN: …その裏にちらつく、雛見沢の昔話。@k鬼ヶ淵村の恐ろしい因習の数々。
TextENG: ...The old stories of Hinamizawa, flickering like a candle behind them.@k The numerous and horrifying traditions of Onigafuchi Village.

TextJPN: 鬼の血が流れている村人。
TextENG: The villagers with demon blood in them.

TextJPN: 人食いの恐ろしい宴。
TextENG: The terrible, cannibalistic feasts.

TextJPN: 哀れな生贄を、人里からさらったという『鬼隠し』。
TextENG: The poor sacrifices kidnapped from human villages, victims... ...of the Onikakushi.

TextJPN: そしてオヤシロさまの怒りを鎮めるための…生贄の儀式。
TextENG: To quell the rage of Oyashiro-sama... the ritual involving living sacrifices.

TextJPN: ……他にも他にも。@k…思い出すだけでも陰鬱になる話がたくさんあった。
TextENG: ......There were also many, many others.@k ...There were so many stories that just remembering them put me in a foul mood.

TextJPN: そしてそれらの多くは、フィクションでなく、事実だったのだ。
TextENG: Most of them weren't fiction, either—they were true.

TextJPN: …だが、事実だったことを恐れる必要はないんだ。@k…それは昔のことなんだから。@kそう、昔の。
TextENG: ...We didn't need to fear them just because they were real, though.@k ...Since it all happened so long ago.@k Such a very long time ago.

TextJPN: 「魅ぃちゃん、遅いね」
TextENG: ``Where's Mii-chan? She's late.``

TextJPN: いつの間にか、魅音との待ち合わせ場所に来ていた。
TextENG: Before I realized it, we had arrived at the place where we'd usually meet with Mion.

TextJPN: …どうもだいぶ考え事に没頭してたみたいだ。
TextENG: ...Probably because I was so lost in thought.

TextJPN: 「この時間になっても来ない時は、先に行ってもいい約束になってるんだけど。@k@vS02/02/130200081.…どうする？」
TextENG: ``We agreed that if she isn't here by now, we can just go on ahead, right?@k@vS02/02/130200081. ...Should we?``

TextJPN: 魅音が遅れてくるのはそんなに珍しいことじゃないが、…今日はいつになく遅いな。
TextENG: Mion being late wasn't too rare an occurrence... but today she was unusually late.

TextJPN: ……再び、脳裏に昨夜の不吉な会話がいくつも蘇る。
TextENG: ......A few of the ominous tales from the night before came back to life in my mind again.

TextJPN: 今年は誰が死んで、誰が消えるんでしょうね…。
TextENG: Who would die this year, and who would disappear...

TextJPN: ……ま、まさか……魅音…？
TextENG: ......I-It couldn't have been... Mion...?

TextJPN: 「どうするかな圭一くん。@k@vS02/02/130200083.…もう行かないと遅刻になっちゃうかも」
TextENG: ``What should we do, Keiichi-kun?@k@vS02/02/130200083. ...If we don't get going, we'll be late.``

TextJPN: 「……来るよ。@k@vS02/01/130100215.学校を休むって電話があったわけじゃないだろ？@k@vS02/01/130100216.　もう５分、待ってみようぜ。な？」
TextENG: ``...She'll be here.@k@vS02/01/130100215. She didn't call to tell us she'd be staying home today, right?@k@vS02/01/130100216. Let's just wait five more minutes. Okay?``

TextJPN: レナは時計を見比べ、ちょっと困ったような顔をしたが、すぐに満面の笑顔で大きく頷いた。
TextENG: Rena looked at her watch and seemed a little worried, but then she nodded with a satisfied smile.

TextJPN: うーん…。
TextENG: Hmm...

TextJPN: ５分待ったら、学校までは全力疾走で行かないとまずいよな…。
TextENG: If we had to wait five minutes, we'd have to run as fast as we could to school or we'd be late...

TextJPN: と、思った時、息を切らせながら走ってくる魅音の姿を見つけた。
TextENG: As soon as I thought that, we spotted Mion, running towards us, out of breath.
``Mii-chaaaaan!!@k@vS02/02/130200085. You're laaaate!!``
``Hah!@k@vS02/03/130300081. Hah!@k@vS02/03/130300082. ...You waited?@k@vS02/03/130300083. Y-You should have just gone on ahead...``

TextJPN: …真っ赤な顔で、荒く息をつく魅音。
TextENG: ...Mion was breathing heavily, and her face was all red.

TextJPN: …魅音の家はこの先をすぐのはずだ。@kそんなに疲れるような距離じゃないはずなんだが。
TextENG: ...Her house was right down this road, wasn't it?@k It wasn't far enough away for her to end up like this, was it?

TextJPN: 「……魅ぃちゃん、…ひょっとして、具合悪くない？」
TextENG: ``......Mii-chan, ...Are you not feeling well?``

TextJPN: え？@k　…そう言えば…。
TextENG: Huh?@k ...Now that she mentioned it...

TextJPN: …レナが魅音の前髪を掻き分けて、その額に手を当てる。
TextENG: ...Rena pushed Mion's bangs away and put her hand to her forehead.

TextJPN: 「…レナの手、冷たいな」
TextENG: ``...Rena, your hand is pretty cold.``

TextJPN: 「魅ぃちゃん…ちょっとだけど熱あるよ？」
TextENG: ``Mii-chan... You're a little bit warm.``

TextJPN: 「そんな大したことないよ。@k@vS02/03/130300086.…半日もすればケロッと治っちゃうって」
TextENG: ``It's no big deal.@k@vS02/03/130300086. ...Give it half a day and I'll be fit as a fiddle.``

TextJPN: 「本当に大丈夫かよ。@k@vS02/01/130100218.…あんまり無理するなよ？」
TextENG: ``Are you really okay?@k@vS02/01/130100218. ...You don't have to push yourself, you know.``

TextJPN: 「あれ？@k@vS02/03/130300088.　圭ちゃん、気遣ってくれるの？@k@vS02/03/130300089.　あはは…うれしいなぁ」
TextENG: ``What's this?@k@vS02/03/130300088. Kei-chan, are you worried about me?@k@vS02/03/130300089. Ahaha... That's nice of you.``

TextJPN: ……いつもの魅音らしくない返答だ。
TextENG: ...That answer wasn't like Mion at all.

TextJPN: …こりゃ重症だな。
TextENG: ...She must have had it pretty bad.

TextJPN: 「む、無理しない方がいいと思うな。@k@vS02/02/130200089.先生にはお休みだって伝えとくよ？」
TextENG: ``I-I just think you shouldn't push yourself so hard.@k@vS02/02/130200089. We can tell the teacher you had to take the day off.``

TextJPN: 「大丈夫大丈夫！@k@vS02/03/130300091.　風邪薬も飲んだし。@k@vS02/03/130300092.すぐに効いてくると思うから」
TextENG: ``I'm fine, I'm fine!@k@vS02/03/130300091. I took some medicine.@k@vS02/03/130300092. I think it's already working.``

TextJPN: 魅音は無理に元気そうに見せて、力こぶを作るようなまねをした。
TextENG: Mion forced an energetic expression onto her face and flexed her biceps at us.

TextJPN: 「じゃあ…行こうか。@k@vS02/01/130100220.くれぐれも無理するなよ、って言いながら。@k@vS02/01/130100221.…時間」
TextENG: ``Okay... then let's go.@k@vS02/01/130100220. Don't overdo it... but, of course, there's...@k@vS02/01/130100221. ...the time.``
``Wah?!@k@vS02/02/130200091. W-We need to run or we won't m-make it~!!``

TextJPN: 「あっははははは！@k@vS02/03/130300094.　スリリングな朝になっちゃったねぇ。@k@vS02/03/130300095.鈍った体にはちょうどいい喝かもね！@k@vS02/03/130300096.　走ろ！」
TextENG: ``Ah-hahahaha!@k@vS02/03/130300094. This morning sure is thrilling!@k@vS02/03/130300095. Maybe it's just what I need to shake off this slowness!@k@vS02/03/130300096. Let's run!``

TextJPN: おいおい…病人が張り切るなよ…！
TextENG: Hey, wait... You're sick! Don't go overboard...!

TextJPN: だが、魅音は元気そうに駆け出していった。
TextENG: Mion began to run vigorously anyway.

TextJPN: 「…魅ぃちゃんだって最上級生だよ？@k@vS02/02/130200093.　自分の体のことは自分で一番よくわかってるよ」
TextENG: ``...Mii-chan is older than us, right?@k@vS02/02/130200093. She knows her own body better than anyone.``

TextJPN: 魅音が大丈夫だという内は、大丈夫ということにしておくか。
TextENG: I decided to leave it at that and assume she was fine.

TextJPN: 「よし、俺たちも行こうぜ！！」
TextENG: ``Great, then we should get going too!!``

TextJPN: 魅音の後を追って、俺たちも走り出した…。
TextENG: We began to run after Mion...

TextJPN: いつもの学校風景だ。
TextENG: The school looked the same as always.

TextJPN: 寝不足にはとてもこたえる気だるい時間…。
TextENG: The hours passed listlessly, and my lack of sleep took its toll...

TextJPN: 熟睡競争なる競技があったなら、今の俺なら世界制覇だな。
TextENG: If there was a sport where people competed by sleeping, I'd be world champion right now.

TextJPN: こういうデンジャラスな状態の時にはシャーペンを逆さにして持つのがコツだ。
TextENG: The trick to overcoming this sort of dangerous situation was to hold your pencil upside-down.

TextJPN: …なぜかって？
TextENG: ...Why, you ask?

TextJPN: 寝ぼけてノートの上に、怪しい模様を書かないためだよ。
TextENG: So you don't draw strange patterns all over your notes while half-asleep.

TextJPN: 逆さにシャーペンを持ってれば、そんなことにはならないだろ？
TextENG: If you were holding your pencil upside-down, that wouldn't happen, would it?

TextJPN: ポコポコポコ！　ポコポコポコ！
TextENG: Bump bump bump! Bump bump bump!

TextJPN: 消しゴムのようなものが６つ、俺の頭にぶつけられる。
TextENG: Something that felt like an eraser hit me in the head six times.

TextJPN: 「いてててて、…何しやがる沙都子ぉ！」
TextENG: ``Ow, ow... What was that for, Satoko?!``

TextJPN: 「わ、私は何もしてないでございますわ…！」
TextENG: ``I-I haven't done a single thing...!``

TextJPN: 「お前以外にこんないたずら誰がするんだよ？！@k@vS02/01/130100225.　あ、消しゴムじゃなくてチョークか。@k@vS02/01/130100226.……へ？」
TextENG: ``Who else would play a prank on me like this?!@k@vS02/01/130100225. Oh, it was chalk, not an eraser.@k@vS02/01/130100226. ......Eh?``

TextJPN: 俺の背後に…まるでスケ番がカミソリでも持つように、両手に３本ずつのチョークを持った先生の影が……。@kゴゴゴゴゴ……。
TextENG: Behind me... like a female outlaw might hold razors, was the teacher's shadow, holding three pieces of chalk in each hand...@k Rumble rumble rumble......

TextJPN: 「前原くん。@k@vS02/22/131400002.…お顔を洗ってらっしゃい」
TextENG: ``Maebara-kun.@k@vS02/22/131400002. ...Go and wash your face.``

TextJPN: 「あ、……は、はい、よ、喜んで…！」
TextENG: ``Uh, ......R-Right, g-gladly...!``

TextJPN: その演出だけで充分に目は覚めたのだが…先生の迫力に気圧される形で、廊下に飛び出したのだった。
TextENG: That alone was enough to wake me up... but I flew out into the hallway, as if shoved out by the pressure exuded by the teacher's sheer power.

TextJPN: 同じ顔を洗うなら、暗い給湯室の流しで洗うより、表の流しを使ったほうが気分がいい。@k…そう思い、昇降口から表へ出た。
TextENG: If I was going to wash my face anyway, then I would rather use the sinks out front, rather than the ones in the dark restroom.@k ...Thinking that, I left the hallway and went to the entrance.

TextJPN: 日差しが強い。@k…とても６月とは思えない。
TextENG: The sunlight was strong.@k ...So strong you wouldn't think it was June.

TextJPN: 蛇口をひねるとじょぼじょぼと景気の悪い音をたてながら、ぬるい水がほとばしる。
TextENG: I turned the faucet, and with a lifeless bubbling noise, lukewarm water came pouring out.

TextJPN: …しばらく出しっ放しにしたら、冷たい水になるだろうか。
TextENG: ...If I let it run for a few moments, would it get cold?

TextJPN: …そう思いながら、しばし放心する。
TextENG: ...I looked at it absent-mindedly for a little while.

TextJPN: 「やっぱ、圭ちゃんはこっちの流しを選んだか。@k@vS02/03/130300098.表の方が気分いいもんね」
TextENG: ``I knew you'd choose these sinks, Kei-chan.@k@vS02/03/130300098. The ones out front just feel better, don't they?``
``Hm... Mion?@k@vS02/01/130100229. ...*Yaaawn*@k@vS02/01/130100230. No cutting class now~``

TextJPN: 流水に手をかざすと、さっきまでがウソのように冷えた水になっていた。
TextENG: I stuck my hands into the water to find it had gotten so cold that it seemed strange it had ever been warm.

TextJPN: それをすくい、バシャバシャと顔に叩き付ける。
TextENG: I scooped it up and splashed it against my face.

TextJPN: 流しを譲ると、魅音も同じ様にバシャバシャとやった。
TextENG: Once I was done, I moved out of the way and Mion did the same.``

TextJPN: 「…魅音、具合の方はいいのかよ。@k@vS02/01/130100232.眠いのは寝不足じゃなくて、薬の副作用なんだろ？」
TextENG: ``...Mion, how is your cold doing?@k@vS02/01/130100232. You're sleepy because of the medicine, not from lack of sleep, right?``

TextJPN: 「ん？@k@vS02/03/130300100.　…あはははは、実は内緒なんだけど…、昨日はお祭りのあとで親族の宴会に巻き込まれちゃってさ」
TextENG: ``Hm?@k@vS02/03/130300100. ...Ahahahaha. Actually, this is a secret, but... after the festival yesterday, I got wrapped up in the party my relatives were having.``

TextJPN: 「それで…実はエンドレスに突入しちゃって」
TextENG: ``And well... things dragged on a while.``

TextJPN: エンドレス。
TextENG: Things dragged on?

TextJPN: 日本語に直すと連続。……ってことはお前、風邪なんじゃなくて…、
TextENG: So, you mean to say... ...You didn't have a cold or anything...

TextJPN: 「つまりホントに、寝不足なのかよー？！@k@vS02/01/130100234.　徹夜明けならそうと言え、まぎらわしい……」
TextENG: ``So you really are just tired?!@k@vS02/01/130100234. If you were up all night, just say so! That was confusing...``

TextJPN: 「なはははは…！@k@vS02/03/130300103.　勘弁してよ。@k@vS02/03/130300104.体調が悪いのは本当なんだからさー」
TextENG: ``Nahahaha...!@k@vS02/03/130300103. Give me a break.@k@vS02/03/130300104. I really don't feel well, you know!``

TextJPN: …確かに体調が悪いのは同じだろうが。@k風邪と徹夜明けじゃ、その扱いは全然違うぞ。
TextENG: ...I suppose she'd be feeling lousy either way.@k Still, you treat colds and sleep deprivation in completely different ways.

TextJPN: 「心配して損したぞ。@k@vS02/01/130100236.ったく…魅音らしいというか何というか…」
TextENG: ``I was worried over nothing.@k@vS02/01/130100236. Man... I guess that's just like you, Mion...``

TextJPN: 魅音は頭をポリポリと掻いて見せた。
TextENG: Mion scratched her head, a little embarrassed.

TextJPN: …確かに具合は悪そうだが、寝不足だとわかればそんなに心配はいらない。ちょっと休めば快調に向かうんだからな。
TextENG: ...She didn't seem to be feeling well, but now that I knew the cause, I didn't need to worry too much. It would go away with a little rest, after all.

TextJPN: 「あ、でも頭がガンガンするのは本当。@k@vS02/03/130300106.だからさ、さっき先生に早退していいって言われちゃった」
TextENG: ``Oh, but my head really is pounding.@k@vS02/03/130300106. So the teacher told me I should go home early.``

TextJPN: 「あ、ずるいヤツ…！@k@vS02/01/130100238.　じゃあ魅音は、もうこれで帰りなのか？」
TextENG: ``Ack, you cheater...!@k@vS02/01/130100238. So are you going home now, Mion?``

TextJPN: 言われて見れば、魅音はカバンを持っていた。このまま帰るつもりらしいな。
TextENG: Now that I looked again, Mion had her bag with her. She must have been on her way home.

TextJPN: 「うん。申し訳ないけどね。@k@vS02/03/130300108.今日は家で大人しく寝させてもらうわ。@k@vS02/03/130300109.…部活、できなくて申し訳ないね。@k@vS02/03/130300110.今日は圭ちゃんがリーダーってことでやってくれない？」
TextENG: ``Yep. I feel bad about it, though.@k@vS02/03/130300108. I'll get some rest at home like a good girl.@k@vS02/03/130300109. ...Sorry I can't make it to the club.@k@vS02/03/130300110. Would you take over as leader for today, Kei-chan?``

TextJPN: 「……多分、無理だと思うぜ。@k@vS02/01/130100240.俺たち、部活は全員揃った時しかやらないっていう暗黙の了解があるだろ。@k@vS02/01/130100241.魅音がバイトに行ってる時は、いつもそのままお開きだったんだぜ？」
TextENG: ``......I don't know if that will happen.@k@vS02/01/130100240. We have that unspoken rule where we don't do the club unless everyone is there, don't we?@k@vS02/01/130100241. We never did it when you had to go to your part-time job, did we?``

TextJPN: 気なんか遣わなくいいのに、そう言って魅音は苦笑いした。
TextENG: Mion laughed wryly, saying we didn't need to worry about her.

TextJPN: でも、どんなに楽しく盛り上がっても、それを共有できない仲間に悪いと思うのは、本当に素晴らしい友情の証なんだと思う。
TextENG: No matter how much fun we have, though, I think that feeling guilty about friends who can't share in it is the sign of a really fantastic friendship.

TextJPN: そういう意味で、魅音が作り上げた部活というのは、素晴らしいものなのだ。
TextENG: In that sense, the club Mion has created is a wonderful thing.

TextJPN: そうしてる内に、洗顔で濡れていた顔はすっかり乾いてしまった。
TextENG: As I thought about it, the moisture on my washed face dried up.

TextJPN: …そう言えばお喋りが過ぎたかな。@kそろそろ教室に戻らないとまずいかもしれない。
TextENG: ...I suppose we were talking too much.@k If I didn't get back to the classroom soon, I could get in trouble.

TextJPN: 「じゃあな。@k@vS02/01/130100243.俺は教室に戻るぜ。@k@vS02/01/130100244.帰りは気をつけろよ。@k@vS02/01/130100245.ふらふらして、側溝や用水路に落ちるなよ」
TextENG: ``Okay, later.@k@vS02/01/130100243. I'm going back.@k@vS02/01/130100244. Be careful on your way home.@k@vS02/01/130100245. Don't wobble into a sewer or a brook, got it?``

TextJPN: 俺はそれだけを告げ、教室に戻ろうと身をひるがえした。
TextENG: I left it at that, turned around, and started heading back to the classroom.

TextJPN: 「あ、…そうそう、圭ちゃん」
TextENG: ``Oh, ...One more thing, Kei-chan.``

TextJPN: 魅音が呼び止めるので、首だけを振り返して聞いた。
TextENG: Mion stopped me, and I turned my head to listen.

TextJPN: 「なんだー？」
TextENG: ``What's up?``

TextJPN: 「変なこと聞くけど、深く考えないで答えてね」
TextENG: ``This may sound weird, but don't think too hard about it.``

TextJPN: 「そりゃ、内容によりけりだな」
TextENG: ``Well, that depends on what it is.``

TextJPN: 「昨日の綿流しの晩さ。…富竹さんと鷹野さんに会わなかった？」
TextENG: ``Last night, near the end of the festival. ...Did you see Tomitake-san or Takano-san anywhere?``

TextJPN: ……ぎくりとして体が強張った。
TextENG: ......I suddenly tensed up.

TextJPN: 「富竹さんと鷹野さんはわかるよね？@k@vS02/03/130300115.　ほら、圭ちゃん、お祭りの前日準備の時、詩音と一緒に４人でお話してたでしょ？」
TextENG: ``You know Tomitake-san and Takano-san, right?@k@vS02/03/130300115. You remember, Kei-chan, when the four of you were talking during setup the day before?``

TextJPN: あの晩の、祭具殿に忍び込んだことは、できるなら早く忘れたい。
TextENG: If I could, I wanted to forget about sneaking into the storehouse that night as soon as possible.

TextJPN: …だからこそ、あの場に居合わせた人たちの名前が出ることが、何だか無性に嫌だった。
TextENG: ...So hearing the names of the people I was with at the time really got to me.

TextJPN: …それよりも。
TextENG: ...Besides that, though.

TextJPN: …どうして魅音は…そんなことを、俺に聞くんだろう…？
TextENG: ...Why was Mion... asking me a question like that...?

TextJPN: 即答できず、魅音の目をじっと見てしまう…。
TextENG: I ended up staring at her, unable to answer immediately...

TextJPN: …魅音の、『会わなかった？』という質問が、質問なのか、会ったことを知った上での詰問なのか、…読みきれない。
TextENG: ...Was she asking to see if I had seen them or not, or was she asking the question knowing that I had...? I couldn't tell.

TextJPN: 「……さ、…さぁ…どうかな。@k@vS02/01/130100249.…会ったような会わなかったような…」
TextENG: ``......W-Well... Maybe?@k@vS02/01/130100249. ...I might have seen them around, I don't know...``

TextJPN: 曖昧な返事が魅音を不愉快にさせているのは明白だった。
TextENG: My vague response was clearly not to Mion's liking.

TextJPN: ……魅音が俺から、どんな答えを期待していたのか…知る術はない。
TextENG: ...What answer was she expecting from me...? There was no way for me to know.
``............I see.@k@vS02/03/130300117. Then, one more question.@k@vS02/03/130300118. On the same night.``

TextJPN: 「詩音に会わなかった？」
TextENG: ``Did you see Shion?``

TextJPN: 再び、心臓が飛び跳ねる。@k……魅音の言葉の裏に潜む、小さな針がチクリと刺した。
TextENG: My heart leapt into my throat again.@k ......The tiny needles buried underneath Mion's words pricked into me.

TextJPN: 「…それ、…昨日も聞いたよな？@k@vS02/01/130100251.　…俺、会ったかどうかわからない、って答えたと思ったぜ…」
TextENG: ``...That... didn't you ask me that yesterday?@k@vS02/01/130100251. ...I think I told you that I wasn't sure if I had or not...``

TextJPN: 「ん、そうだっけ？@k@|@y@vS02/03/130300121.　…また改めて聞いたら、違う答えが返ってくるかなって思ってさ」
TextENG: ``Hm, did you?@k@|@y@vS02/03/130300121. ...I guess I just thought I'd get a different answer if I asked you again.``

TextJPN: 魅音の眼差しに…いつの間にか得体の知れない、何かが宿っていた。
TextENG: I suddenly noticed something in Mion's eyes... something indescribable.

TextJPN: 富竹さんに鷹野さん。
TextENG: Tomitake-san and Takano-san.

TextJPN: そして詩音。
TextENG: Shion, too.

TextJPN: …そして、それを俺に聞く。
TextENG: ...She was asking me about them.

TextJPN: ……間違いない。
TextENG: ......There was no doubt about it.

TextJPN: …昨夜、祭具殿に忍び込んだ４人…全て。
TextENG: ...Last night, the four of us snuck into the ritual storehouse... she knew everything.

TextJPN: …で、でも…だから、何だってんだ？！@k　別に祟りがあるわけでも……！
TextENG: ...S-So... So what?!@k There's not really a curse anyway......!

TextJPN: …そうだよ。
TextENG: ...That's right.

TextJPN: 祟りなんかないって、祭りの前日に詩音も鷹野さんも言ってたじゃないか。
TextENG: Even Shion and Takano-san said yesterday during the festival that there was no curse.

TextJPN: …祟りよりもむしろ、村人の仕業だって…。@k…………………………血が凍る。
TextENG: ...And that rather than a curse, it was the doing of the villagers...@k ..................................My blood curdled.

TextJPN: …魅音は、…ほぼ間違いなく、…祭具殿に忍び込んだことを知っている…？
TextENG: ...Mion was... ...almost without a doubt... ...aware that we snuck into the storehouse...?

TextJPN: それを不思議がることはない。
TextENG: It was nothing strange.

TextJPN: ……灯りのスイッチを押すという致命的なミスを、昨夜、俺が犯してる。
TextENG: ......I screwed up bad flipping on the light switch last night.

TextJPN: …その一瞬の灯りを、俺を捜していた魅音が見かけて、様子をうかがっていた…なんてのは想像に容易だ。
TextENG: ...If Mion had been searching for me, it was simple to imagine... that she had seen that momentary light and come to find out what was going on.

TextJPN: 「……本当に会ってないんだね？」
TextENG: ``...Did you really not see her?``

TextJPN: 「ど、どうして会ったかどうかを、そんなに気にするんだよ？」
TextENG: ``W-Why are you so intent on knowing if I did or not?``

TextJPN: 「大したことじゃないの。@k@vS02/03/130300124.…富竹さんと鷹野さんと、詩音と圭ちゃんをね。@k@vS02/03/130300125.…悪く言ってる人たちがいるの。@k@vS02/03/130300126.……何が悪いんだかはよく聞いてないんだけどね」
TextENG: ``It's not important.@k@vS02/03/130300124. ...It's just that there are some people...@k@vS02/03/130300125. ...who are speaking poorly of Tomitake-san, Takano-san, Shion, and you, Kei-chan.@k@vS02/03/130300126. ......I didn't really hear what they were saying, though.``

TextJPN: 嫌な汗がじっとりと腕を伝い…指先からポタポタと垂れる音が嫌にうるさい…。
TextENG: Unpleasant sweat dripped down my arms... and the sound of it hanging from my fingertips was so annoyingly loud...

TextJPN: 「私、圭ちゃんが悪いことをするなんて信じてないから。@k@vS02/03/130300128.…でも、ちょっとだけ聞いてみたかったから、聞いてみたの。@k@vS02/03/130300129.…不愉快な思いをさせて、ごめんね？」
TextENG: ``I don't believe that you were doing something bad.@k@vS02/03/130300128. ...I just wanted to ask a bit about it, so I did.@k@vS02/03/130300129. ...Sorry for making you uncomfortable, okay?``

TextJPN: ……何も返事をすることができない。
TextENG: ......I found myself unable to reply.

TextJPN: …そういう反応が、如実に真実を物語ってしまっているに違いないのに…取り繕うことができない。
TextENG: ...My reaction must have made it obvious what the truth was... and yet I couldn't explain myself.

TextJPN: 「圭ちゃんは富竹さんとも鷹野さんとも、そして詩音とも一緒じゃなかった。@k@vS02/03/130300131.……そうだよね？」
TextENG: ``Kei-chan, you weren't with Tomitake-san, Takano-san, or Shion.@k@vS02/03/130300131. ...Right?``

TextJPN: 苦しい息の中から、やっとひねり出した俺の返事に、魅音は少し表情を緩やかにした。
TextENG: I finally wrung out an answer between ragged breaths. Mion's expression softened a little.

TextJPN: 「……よかった。@k@vS02/03/130300133.私、言っとくね。@k@vS02/03/130300134.圭ちゃんは何も悪いことには加わってないって。@k@vS02/03/130300135.…みんなにちゃんと言っておくからね」
TextENG: ``...That's good.@k@vS02/03/130300133. I'll have to tell them.@k@vS02/03/130300134. You weren't involved in anything bad, Kei-chan,@k@vS02/03/130300135. so... I'll make sure to tell everyone.``

TextJPN: …あぁ…言っておいてくれ。
TextENG: ...Yeah... please do.

TextJPN: …俺は別に…何も悪いことはしてないって。
TextENG: ...Tell them I wasn't... doing anything bad.

TextJPN: …みんなに…ちゃんと。@k……みんな。@k……みんなって…誰だよ…？
TextENG: ...To everyone... make sure...@k ......Everyone.@k ......Everyone... who is everyone...?
``Okay, later.@k@vS02/03/130300137. I'll be better tomorrow!@k@vS02/03/130300138. Bye-bye!``

TextJPN: ま、待てよ魅音！！@k　みんなって一体…！！
TextENG: W-Wait, Mion!!@k What do you mean by 'everyone'...?!!

TextJPN: その時！！@k　俺の首筋に、冷え切った手が当てられるッ！！！！
TextENG: Just then!!@k A freezing cold hand touched the back of my neck!!!!

TextJPN: 「こぉら！@k@vS02/22/131400004.　遅いですよ前原くん。@k@vS02/22/131400005.顔を洗うだけなのに、時間がかかり過ぎです！」
TextENG: ``Hey!@k@vS02/22/131400004. You're late, Maebara-kun.@k@vS02/22/131400005. How long does it take you to wash your face?``

TextJPN: ……先生だった。
TextENG: ......It was the teacher.

TextJPN: …俺があまりに遅いので、呼びに来たのだろう…。
TextENG: ...I was taking so long she came out to get me...

TextJPN: 「あ、すみません…。@k@vS02/01/130100255.つい魅音とお喋りを……」
TextENG: ``Ah, I'm sorry...@k@vS02/01/130100255. I was just speaking to Mion......``

TextJPN: 振り返ると、当の魅音はいつの間にか校庭を横断して、もう門のところにいた。
TextENG: I turned around, but Mion had crossed through the schoolyard without me realizing it and was now standing at the gate.

TextJPN: 「さ、お勉強に戻りますよ！@k@vS02/22/131400007.　早く早く」
TextENG: ``Come, back to your studies!@k@vS02/22/131400007. Quickly now.``

TextJPN: 先生に促され、昇降口に戻る。
TextENG: The teacher was being insistent. We returned to the entrance.

TextJPN: …もう一度振り返った時、もう魅音の姿は見えなくなっていた。
TextENG: ...I looked back one more time, and Mion was nowhere in sight.

TextJPN: 「……圭一、今日はずーっと元気がないのです」
TextENG: ``......Keiichi, you haven't seemed well all day.``

TextJPN: 「昨日、大はしゃぎし過ぎたからに違いありませんわー！」
TextENG: ``It's clearly because he had far too much fun yesterday!``

TextJPN: 「迷子になって、目を真っ赤にさせて半泣きしてたヤツに言われたくねー」
TextENG: ``I don't want to be told that by the one who got lost. Your face was all red and you were nearly crying!``

TextJPN: 「あ、あははははは～！！」
TextENG: ``Ah, ahahahaha~!!``

TextJPN: 「ゆ、昨夜の沙都子ちゃん、か、かぁいかったよ！　はぅ～！！」
TextENG: ``S-Satoko-chan was so...so kyuute last night! Hau~!!``

TextJPN: 仲間が俺を元気付けようとがんばってくれるのだが…気は晴れなかった。
TextENG: My friends did their best to try and cheer me up... but it didn't lighten my mood.

TextJPN: 自分で思っているよりも遥かに。@k……俺は昨夜、とんでもないことをしてしまったんじゃないだろうか…？
TextENG: Was it far worse than I thought?@k ...Had I really done something that terrible last night...?

TextJPN: そんな思いが、今日一日が終わるまで…ずーっと苛んでいた。
TextENG: These thoughts remained with me... for the rest of the day.

TextJPN: 「…じゃあね、圭一くん。@k@vS02/02/130200097.また明日ね」
TextENG: ``...Bye, Keiichi-kun.@k@vS02/02/130200097. I'll see you tomorrow!``

TextJPN: 気付けば、いつの間にか自分の家の前だった。
TextENG: By the time I realized it, I was in front of my own house.

TextJPN: 「……魅ぃちゃんも風邪だったみたいだけど、…ひょっとして圭一くんもなのかな？　かな？」
TextENG: ``...Mii-chan had a cold, right? ...Could you have a cold too, Keiichi-kun? Could you?``

TextJPN: 「え、……大丈夫だよ。@k@vS02/01/130100259.こう見えても、風邪で休んだことはないんだぜ？」
TextENG: ``Huh? ...I'm fine.@k@vS02/01/130100259. I may look scrawny, but I've never missed school because of a cold!``

TextJPN: 「でも、魅ぃちゃんも圭一くんも、今日は具合が悪そうだし…」
TextENG: ``Both you and Mii-chan didn't look so good today, though...``

TextJPN: 「…気にしてくれてありがとな。@k@vS02/01/130100261.大丈夫！　バカは風邪引かないんだぜ？」
TextENG: ``...Thanks for worrying about me.@k@vS02/01/130100261. I'm fine! Idiots don't catch colds, remember?``

TextJPN: レナは笑って手を振りながら、去って行った。
TextENG: Rena smiled, then waved to me and left.

TextJPN: …ふぅ。
TextENG: ...Hoo.

TextJPN: …肩で重い息を吐きながら玄関に入った。
TextENG: ...With my shoulders bobbing up and down from breathing heavily, I entered the house.

TextJPN: 帰ってきて早々、お袋に呼ばれる。
TextENG: As soon as I got back in, Mom called out to me.
``What?``

TextJPN: 「圭一。@k@vS02/00/132700005.悪いんだけど、図書館に行って本を返してきてくれない？」
TextENG: ``Keiichi?@k@vS02/00/132700005. I'm sorry, but could you go to the library and return a few books for me?``

TextJPN: 「…えー、面倒くさいなぁ…！」
TextENG: ``...Huh? I don't feel like it...!``

TextJPN: 「お父さんもお母さんも、今ね、ちょっと電話待ちをしてるところで家を空けられないの。@k@vS02/00/132700007.返却期限も今日までだし、お願いできない？」
TextENG: ``Your dad and I have to wait inside the house for a phone call right now, so we can't leave.@k@vS02/00/132700007. I need to return them today. Could you please do it?``

TextJPN: ……やれやれ。
TextENG: ......Sheesh.

TextJPN: 親父の仕事の絡みかな？@k　仕事の話を持ち出されたら逆らいようがない。
TextENG: Did it have to do with Dad's job?@k No point in arguing if they bring that up.

TextJPN: 「仕方ないなぁ。@k@vS02/01/130100265.…でも俺、図書館がどこにあるか知らないよ」
TextENG: ``I guess so... @k@vS02/01/130100265. But I don't know where the library is.``

TextJPN: 「あら、知らないの？@k@vS02/00/132700009.　興宮の駅前をちょっと進んで…、」
TextENG: ``Oh, you don't?@k@vS02/00/132700009. It's a little bit past Okinomiya Station...``

TextJPN: その時、電話が鳴った。
TextENG: Just then, the phone rang.

TextJPN: 両親の顔が一気に険しくなる。
TextENG: My parents' faces immediately turned grim.

TextJPN: …お袋が受話器をひったくった。
TextENG: ...Mom snatched up the receiver.
``Hello!@k@vS02/00/132700011. Maebara speaking. ......I'm sorry?@k@vS02/00/132700012. Yes. He's right here.``

TextJPN: その受話器が、今度は俺の鼻先に突き出される。
TextENG: Then she thrust the receiver at my face.

TextJPN: 「圭一に電話よ。@k@vS02/00/132700014.早めに終わらせてね」
TextENG: ``It's for you, Keiichi.@k@vS02/00/132700014. Don't take too long, okay?``

TextJPN: 誰から、と聞こうとしたが、それは電話の向こうの相手に直接聞いた方が早い。
TextENG: I tried to ask who it was from, but asking the person on the phone directly would be faster.

TextJPN: 「もしもし」
TextENG: ``Hello?``

TextJPN: 「あ、…園崎の妹の方です。@k@vS02/06/130600151.こんにちは。@k@vS02/06/130600152.今はお時間、大丈夫ですか？」
TextENG: ``Ah... This is Sonozaki. Well, the younger one.@k@vS02/06/130600151. Hello.@k@vS02/06/130600152. Do you have time to talk right now?``

TextJPN: 詩音だった。
TextENG: It was Shion.

TextJPN: …姉は徹夜明けで眠そうだったのに、妹の方はケロッとしている。
TextENG: ...The older sister shattered from an all nighter, but the younger seemed fine.

TextJPN: 「詩音か。@k@vS02/01/130100268.魅音と同じで、今日は徹夜明けで寝込んでるんじゃないかと思ったぜ」
TextENG: ``Shion?@k@vS02/01/130100268. I thought you'd be catching up on your sleep today, same as Mion.``

TextJPN: 「え？@k@vS02/06/130600154.　それじゃお姉、今日はズル休みですか？@k@vS02/06/130600155.　あっはははははは！　お姉らし～～！」
TextENG: ``What?@k@vS02/06/130600154. Is Mion playing truant today?@k@vS02/06/130600155. Ah-hahahaha! That's so like her~~!``

TextJPN: 和やかに談笑してしまったが、お袋が、早く電話を終わらせろという顔で睨んでいる。
TextENG: She laughed warmly, but Mom glared at me, silently telling me to finish up.

TextJPN: 「……とと、…ごめんな。@k@vS02/01/130100270.ちょっと親が電話待ちをしてるんで、そんなに長話はできないんだ。@k@vS02/01/130100271.…何の用だ？」
TextENG: ``......Whoops... sorry.@k@vS02/01/130100270. My parents are waiting for an important call, so I can't talk for too long.@k@vS02/01/130100271. ...What do you need?``

TextJPN: 「…お話ししたいことがあったんですけど…長電話が無理じゃ仕方ないですね…」
TextENG: ``...There's something I wanted to talk about... but if we can't talk long, I guess that's that...``

TextJPN: 少し落胆したような言い方だった。
TextENG: She sounded a little disappointed.

TextJPN: …詩音がわざわざ話したいことって何だろう。@k興味はあった。
TextENG: ...What would Shion want to talk to me about?@k Now I was interested.

TextJPN: 「じゃあさ、会って話をしないか？@k@vS02/01/130100273.　ついでに図書館にも案内してもらえるとありがたい」
TextENG: ``Then how about we meet in person?@k@vS02/01/130100273. If you could show me where the library is too, that would be great.``

TextJPN: 「図書館って、駅前の市立図書館ですか？@k@vS02/06/130600158.　別にいいですよ。@k@vS02/06/130600159.バイトのついでってことで」
TextENG: ``You mean the public library near the station?@k@vS02/06/130600158. Yes, that's fine.@k@vS02/06/130600159. I go past there on my way to work anyway.``

TextJPN: 「じゃあ、いつも魅音と待ち合わせてる場所、わかるか？@k@vS02/01/130100275.　園崎家の小道に分かれる分岐の、」
TextENG: ``Okay, then you know where I usually meet up with Mion?@k@vS02/01/130100275. At that intersection where the small path from the Sonozaki house splits—``

TextJPN: 「あ、圭ちゃん。@k@vS02/06/130600161.言ってませんでしたっけ？@k@vS02/06/130600162.　私、本家じゃなくて興宮の家に住んでるんですよ。@k@vS02/06/130600163.だから待ち合わせ場所は、興宮駅の改札前なんかにしてくれた方がうれしいんですけど」
TextENG: ``Oh, Kei-chan,@k@vS02/06/130600161. did I not tell you?@k@vS02/06/130600162. I don't live at the main house; I live in Okinomiya.@k@vS02/06/130600163. If we could meet by the ticket machines at Okinomiya Station, that would be great.``

TextJPN: 本家？@k　興宮の家？
TextENG: Main house?@k Living in Okinomiya?

TextJPN: ……そう言えば、園崎姉妹って、何となく疎通が取れてないと常々思ってたんだが…住んでる家が違うのかな？
TextENG: ......Now that she mentioned it, it's always seemed like the Sonozaki sisters weren't communicating... did they live in different houses?

TextJPN: そう言えばレナも、遊びに行って妹なんかに会ったことがないって言ってたよな。
TextENG: Also now that she mentioned it, Rena said she'd never met the younger sister, despite going over to play sometimes.
``Let's meet at the station, then.@k@vS02/01/130100277. I'll go there right away.@k@vS02/01/130100278. Bye!``

TextJPN: 受話器を置くと、すぐにお袋が分厚い文庫本を鼻先に突き出してきた。
TextENG: I set the receiver down, and Mom immediately thrust a large pile of library books in my face.

TextJPN: …長編推理小説が６冊。@k…お袋も好きだなぁ。
TextENG: ...Six volumes of long-form mystery novels.@k ...Mom had her own hobbies.

TextJPN: 「圭一、よろしくね。@k@vS02/00/132700016.お夕飯までには帰るのよ」
TextENG: ``Thank you, Keiichi.@k@vS02/00/132700016. Be back by nightfall.``

TextJPN: 「へーい。@k@vS02/01/130100280.んじゃ、行ってくるよ」
TextENG: ``Got it.@k@vS02/01/130100280. Okay, I'm going.``

TextJPN: とりあえず、着替えと自転車のカギだ。
TextENG: I supposed I'd change my clothes and grab my bike key.

TextJPN: 俺は自室への階段を登って行った。
TextENG: I climbed the stairs to my bedroom.

TextJPN: 詩音は先に待っててくれたので、合流はとてもスムーズだった。
TextENG: Shion had been waiting for me already, so meeting up was a smooth process.

TextJPN: 「魅音と違って、詩音は待ち合わせ時間を守るなぁ…。@k@vS02/01/130100282.しみじみ」
TextENG: ``Wow, Mion never keeps her appointments...@k@vS02/01/130100282. I mean, honestly.``

TextJPN: 「あはははは。@k@vS02/06/130600165.お姉を標準にされるといろいろと困ります」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha.@k@vS02/06/130600165. Making my sister the standard for everything will get you in trouble.``

TextJPN: ん？
TextENG: Hm?

TextJPN: 詩音も、何となくふらふらなような。…こいつも魅音同様、今日は徹夜明けだな？
TextENG: Shion seemed a little unsteady too. ...She was up all night with Mion, wasn't she?

TextJPN: 「お前も昨夜は寝てないんだろ。@k@vS02/01/130100284.隠しても無駄だぞー。@k@vS02/01/130100285.で、学校を早退したに違いない」
TextENG: ``You didn't get any sleep last night either, did you?@k@vS02/01/130100284. Don't try and hide it!@k@vS02/01/130100285. You definitely went home from school early.``

TextJPN: 「残念でした。@k@vS02/06/130600167.私はそもそも、今日はズル休みしてますので。@k@vS02/06/130600168.私、お姉より要領いいですから」
TextENG: ``Ooh, too bad!@k@vS02/06/130600167. I've been at home all day in the first place.@k@vS02/06/130600168. I'm smarter than Mion, after all.``

TextJPN: おいおい…。
TextENG: Hey...

TextJPN: 学校をズル休みするのを要領いいとは言わないと思うぞ…。
TextENG: I don't think you can call playing hooky 'smarter'...

TextJPN: 「じゃ、先に用事を片付けます？@k@vS02/06/130600170.　時間もそんなにないですから。@k@vS02/06/130600171.…図書館へ行くんですよね」
TextENG: ``You should finish your errand first.@k@vS02/06/130600170. We don't have that much time.@k@vS02/06/130600171. ...We're going to the library, right?``

TextJPN: 「あぁ、頼むよ。@k@vS02/01/130100287.お袋の借りてる本の返却期限が今日までらしいんで。@k@vS02/01/130100288.…図書館は遠いのか？」
TextENG: ``Yeah, thanks.@k@vS02/01/130100287. My mom had to return some books by today.@k@vS02/01/130100288. ...Is the library far?``

TextJPN: 「すぐ近くですよ」
TextENG: ``No, it's really close by.``

TextJPN: 詩音の言うとおり、図書館の案内看板はすぐに見つけられた。
TextENG: As she said that, we spotted the signboard for the library almost immediately.

TextJPN: こんなにわかりやすいところにあるなら、詩音にわざわざ案内してもらうまでもなかったな…。
TextENG: If it was this easy to find, then I guess I didn't need Shion to show me where it was after all...

TextJPN: ちょっと通りを曲がると、その建物はすぐに見つかった。
TextENG: We rode around a bend and the building was right there.

TextJPN: 鹿骨市立図書館。
TextENG: Shishibone Public Library.

TextJPN: 田舎の図書館だからと期待していなかったのだが…なかなか大きい。
TextENG: We lived in the country, so I hadn't expected too much... but it was pretty big.

TextJPN: 実際には１階はお役所になっているので、２階部分だけが図書館なのだが、それでも蔵書の数はかなりありそうだった。
TextENG: The first floor was actually a government office, so the library was only on the second floor, but it still looked large enough to fit a decent collection of books.

TextJPN: 自動ドアをくぐるとエアカーテンの涼しさが迎える。
TextENG: We passed through the automatic doors and were greeted by the cool breeze of an air curtain.

TextJPN: セミの声で充満した外より静かな館内。
TextENG: The cicadas had been loud outside, but it was quiet inside the library.

TextJPN: 本にとって理想的なコンディションに保たれた空調。あと、古書独特のカビに似た匂い…。
TextENG: The air conditioning inside was keeping the temperature at an ideal level for the books, which had that mildewy smell unique to old paper...

TextJPN: 「…どこの図書館も似たようなもんだな」
TextENG: ``...I guess every library is basically the same.``

TextJPN: 一点違うところがあるとすれば…受験軍団が席を埋めていない点くらいかな。
TextENG: If there was one difference... it was that people studying for tests weren't taking up all the seats.

TextJPN: かつてその内の一人だったことが今では遠い昔のようだ。
TextENG: I was one of those people, but now that seemed like a distant memory.

TextJPN: 「すみません、返却に来ました」
TextENG: ``Hello, I have books I'd like to return.``

TextJPN: 返却の手続きを済ませ、お袋の貸出カードを返してもらう。
TextENG: The librarian went through the process of checking them in, and then returned my Mom's library card.

TextJPN: 詩音はあまり図書館には来ないタイプなのか、興味深そうに、本棚の間を行ったり来たりしていた。
TextENG: Shion was going around the bookshelves with a deeply interested look on her face, like she wasn't the type who went to libraries very often.
``...Sorry for the wait.@k@vS02/01/130100292. I'm all done.``

TextJPN: 「図書館って、涼しくていいところですね～。@k@vS02/06/130600174.私、将来は図書館で働きたいです」
TextENG: ``Libraries sure are nice and cool, aren't they~@k@vS02/06/130600174. I want to work in a library one day.``

TextJPN: 「地味というか堅実というか……姉と比べるとずいぶんとささやかな希望だな」
TextENG: ``Don't know whether to call that boring or dependable... It's a pretty small dream compared to your sister.``

TextJPN: 魅音なら、国際商社のバリバリ社員とか、とにかく世界を縦横無尽に駆け巡る派手な職業を希望するに違いない。
TextENG: Mion would definitely want to be a hardworking employee for an international trading company, or some other crazy job that involved her running all around the world.

TextJPN: それに比べると…何とも微笑ましいものだ。
TextENG: Compared to that... what Shion said is pretty heart-warming.

TextJPN: 「まぁ、互いの持ち味を大切にしたいですよね。@k@vS02/06/130600176.私たち、分身じゃなくて、詩音と魅音という、ちゃんとした個人なんですから」
TextENG: ``Well, we need to keep our differences dear to us.@k@vS02/06/130600176. We're not copies—we're two different people, called Shion and Mion.``

TextJPN: 「…双子は双子なりに、いろいろと考えてるんだな。@k@vS02/01/130100295.でも楽しそうだよな。@k@vS02/01/130100296.…俺には兄弟はいないから、家には俺以外は親しかいない。@k@vS02/01/130100297.窮屈なもんだよ」
TextENG: ``...Twins have a lot to think about, huh?@k@vS02/01/130100295. Still, it sounds like fun.@k@vS02/01/130100296. ...I don't have any brothers, so there's just me and my parents at my house.@k@vS02/01/130100297. It can get a little uncomfortable.``

TextJPN: 「私だってそうです。@k@vS02/06/130600178.お姉とは一緒に住んでるわけじゃないですから」
TextENG: ``It's the same for me.@k@vS02/06/130600178. I don't live with Mion, after all.``

TextJPN: そう言えば、そんなことを言ってたっけ…。@kでもどうして？@k　姉妹で別居なんて珍しい。
TextENG: Oh, right, she said something like that, didn't she...@k Why, though?@k Sisters living apart is unusual.

TextJPN: 歩きながら話をするのも疲れるし。
TextENG: We were getting tired of talking while we were walking.

TextJPN: …結局、ひと気のない休憩コーナーでお喋りをすることになった。
TextENG: ...We ended up going to the lounge area, which was vacant, and continuing the conversation.

TextJPN: 「あははははは。@k@vS02/06/130600180.えぇ。@k@vS02/06/130600181.お姉は本家に、私は興宮の家に住んでるんです」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha.@k@vS02/06/130600180. Yes.@k@vS02/06/130600181. Mion lives at the main house, and I live in Okinomiya.``

TextJPN: 「本家って何だ？@k@vS02/01/130100299.　…ずいぶんと、立派な響きがあるけどな」
TextENG: ``What do you mean by 'main house'?@k@vS02/01/130100299. ...You make it sound like you're nobility.``

TextJPN: 「本家は本家です。@k@vS02/06/130600183.園崎家の本家。@k@vS02/06/130600184.お姉は跡取りだから、婆っちゃと一緒に住んで、いろいろと当主としての修行をさせられてるみたいです」
TextENG: ``It's just the main house.@k@vS02/06/130600183. The Sonozaki family's main house.@k@vS02/06/130600184. Mion's the successor, so she lives with Nana and apparently studies all sorts of things as preparation to be the head of the family.``

TextJPN: 魅音が…当主？
TextENG: Mion... the head of the family?

TextJPN: 何だか似合うというか、似合わないというか…。
TextENG: It kind of fit her personality, but kind of didn't, too...

TextJPN: 「圭ちゃんは引っ越してきたばかりでしたよね。@k@vS02/06/130600186.…自分で言うのも何ですけど、園崎家って、ここいらじゃ結構、名士なんですよ？」
TextENG: ``Kei-chan, you just moved here, right?@k@vS02/06/130600186. ...This will sound like I'm boasting, but we of the Sonozaki family are kind of personages around here.``

TextJPN: 「え、…本当かよ？」
TextENG: ``Huh? ...Seriously?``

TextJPN: 魅音や詩音の、あまりに気さくな雰囲気からは、とても名士という言葉とは結びつかない。
TextENG: The word ``personage`` didn't really match the extremely sociable air that Mion and Shion gave off.

TextJPN: 詩音が言うには、…園崎家というのは元々、雛見沢の旧家だったが、戦後にいろいろな事業で成功して大きく勢力を伸ばしたのだと言う。
TextENG: From what Shion explained... The Sonozaki family goes way back to the beginnings of Hinamizawa. After the war, they had a bunch of successful ventures and extended their influence to a wide area.

TextJPN: 「園崎家はですね、親族全体で助け合う土壌があるんです。@k@vS02/06/130600188.…今の当主の婆っちゃが築き上げたんですけどね」
TextENG: ``The Sonozaki house is a foundation under which the entire family cooperates.@k@vS02/06/130600188. ...Though the current family head, Grandma, was the one who built it.``

TextJPN: ひとりの親族の事業を助けるため、親族全体が様々なバックアップをする…。@kそれは園崎家という大きな会社・生き物のようだった。
TextENG: The entire family would provide backup to help one relative with a business venture...@k They were like a huge, living company.

TextJPN: 税法上のトラブルを潜り抜け、豊富な資金力で次々と親類は事業に成功。
TextENG: This let them avoid tax-related problems and help relatives' ventures succeed, one after another, using large amounts of money.

TextJPN: 「興宮の町を歩くことがあったら、看板とかを意識して見て下さい。@k@vS02/06/130600190.園崎の親族が経営してるお店ってとても多いんですよ」
TextENG: ``If you ever go for a walk through Okinomiya, pay attention to the signboards and stuff.@k@vS02/06/130600190. There's a ton of shops that are managed by members of the Sonozaki family.``

TextJPN: 「…言われて見れば…。@k@vS02/01/130100302.例のおもちゃ屋も、親類の人が経営してるみたいだったなぁ。@k@vS02/01/130100303.そう言えば、エンジェルモートも親類の人が経営してるんじゃないのか？」
TextENG: ``...Now that you mention it...@k@vS02/01/130100302. That toy store looked like it was managed by relatives as well.@k@vS02/01/130100303. Does that mean your relatives operate Angel Mort too?``

TextJPN: …俺の知ってるほんのわずかの店ですら、園崎の一族が関わっているとは…。@kさすがに驚く。
TextENG: ...Even what few shops I was familiar with were involved with the Sonozaki family...@k It was definitely surprising.

TextJPN: 「特に金融・不動産関係は強いですね。@k@vS02/06/130600192.あと、商工会議所の役員も何割かは園崎姓か、その親類が就いてます。@k@vS02/06/130600193.興宮一帯を票田に、市議会議員と県議会議員にも園崎がいますし」
TextENG: ``The family is particularly strong in finance and real estate.@k@vS02/06/130600192. Even a lot of members of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry either have the last name Sonozaki, or are their relatives.@k@vS02/06/130600193. There are Sonozakis in the city council and the prefectural assembly, too, since they have the Okinomiya area giving them strong electoral support.``

TextJPN: 「……ちょっと待て。@k@vS02/01/130100305.…なんだか…すごい話になって来たぞ」
TextENG: ``......Wait a minute.@k@vS02/01/130100305. ...This is all... escalating pretty quickly.``

TextJPN: 興宮の町中に親類が経営する店があって、特に金融・不動産に強い…？
TextENG: Her relatives operate shops in downtown Okinomiya, and they're especially strong in finance and real estate...?

TextJPN: しかもその上、商工会議所の役員の何割かが親類で、しかも地元選出の議員までいて…。
TextENG: On top of that, a lot of those in the Chamber of Commerce and Industry are relatives, and there are even people elected to local offices...

TextJPN: 「…ひょっとして、@k@vS02/01/130100307.……園崎家って、この辺り一帯じゃ…すごいんじゃ…？」
TextENG: ``...So then...@k@vS02/01/130100307. ......The Sonozaki family, it's... it's pretty famous in this area...?``

TextJPN: 突然、タバコをくわえた太ったおっさんが話に割り込んできた。
TextENG: All of a sudden, a cigarette-smoking, overweight old man interrupted our conversation.

TextJPN: …あれ…このおっさんは確か……。
TextENG: ...Wait... I know this guy......
``Hello!@k@vS02/11/130700005. Good afternoon.@k@vS02/11/130700006. Are you on a date today?@k@vS02/11/130700007. Ah, what I would give to be young again.``

TextJPN: 「そうだと思ったら邪魔しないでほしかったですね。@k@vS02/06/130600195.大石さん」
TextENG: ``If you thought we were on a date, then why are you bothering us...@k@vS02/06/130600195. Ooishi-san?``

TextJPN: そうだ。@k警察の大石さんだ。
TextENG: That was it.@k He was Ooishi-san, a police officer.

TextJPN: ………そう言えば、魅音とは仲が悪そうだったな。
TextENG: .....Now that I thought about it, Mion didn't seem to like him very much.

TextJPN: 「いえいえ、すみません。@k@vS02/11/130700009.知ってる声が聞こえてきたので、ついつい」
TextENG: ``No, no, I apologize.@k@vS02/11/130700009. I heard a familiar voice, so I came over to see.``

TextJPN: 悪びれた様子もなく下品に笑う大石さん。
TextENG: Ooishi-san laughed coarsely, not showing any sign of giving up.

TextJPN: …それを見る詩音には、魅音が感じさせたほどの嫌悪感はないようだった。
TextENG: ...As Shion watched him do so, I didn't feel the same sense of malice from her as I had from Mion.

TextJPN: 「前原さん、でしたよね？@k@vS02/11/130700011.　あなたもタフな人ですねぇ。@k@vS02/11/130700012.園崎姉妹を二股かけるなんて」
TextENG: ``Maebara-san, right?@k@vS02/11/130700011. You're one tough guy.@k@vS02/11/130700012. Two-timing the Sonozaki sisters, are you?``

TextJPN: 「いや…そんな…、二股だなんて…」
TextENG: ``No, I... I'm not two-timing anyone...``

TextJPN: 同意を求めたくて詩音に振り返ったが、@kにやにやと笑うだけで助け舟を出してはくれなかった。
TextENG: I turned around to look at Shion and plead for help,@k but she grinned and maintained her silence.

TextJPN: 詩音の目線が泳ぐ。@k…その先には時計があった。
TextENG: Her gaze wandered.@k ...She looked at the clock.

TextJPN: 「あ、ごめんなさい圭ちゃん。@k@vS02/06/130600197.…私、もうバイトの時間なんです」
TextENG: ``Ah, I'm sorry, Kei-chan.@k@vS02/06/130600197. ...I really need to get to my job.``

TextJPN: そう言えば…、今日は詩音、何か話があるんじゃなかったのか…？
TextENG: Wait... Didn't Shion have something to talk about today...?

TextJPN: でも…変なおっさんはいるし…。
TextENG: ...Now this weird man is here, though...

TextJPN: 「うん、また今度…。@k@vS02/06/130600199.あ、バイトが終わったら電話します。@k@vS02/06/130600200.夜なら電話、大丈夫ですよね？」
TextENG: ``Yep. I'll see you later...@k@vS02/06/130600199. Oh, I'll give you a call after I'm done.@k@vS02/06/130600200. It'll be okay to call at night, right?``
``Yeah.@k@vS02/01/130100312. Probably okay.``

TextJPN: 「じゃあ、今夜電話しますので、その時に。@k@vS02/06/130600202.じゃ！」
TextENG: ``Then I'll talk to you later tonight.@k@vS02/06/130600202. Bye!``

TextJPN: そそくさと、逃げるように詩音は駆けて行ってしまった。
TextENG: Shion left so fast she was practically running.

TextJPN: …大石さんが俺の脇でにこにこと手を振っている。
TextENG: ...Ooishi-san was waving beside me with a grin.

TextJPN: ……何だか俺をダシにして逃げたような感じがしなくもない。@k…本当にバイトがあるのかも怪しいな…。
TextENG: ......I felt like I'd been left here as bait so she could get away.@k ...Maybe she was lying about having to go to work...

TextJPN: 「…園崎のご令嬢とこれだけ親しくできるなんて、前原さんもなかなかの大物ですねぇ。@k@vS02/11/130700014.私も口の利き方を改めた方がいいかもしれません。んっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``...You're quite the big shot, being so close to the Sonozaki daughters.@k@vS02/11/130700014. Maybe I should rethink how I talk to you, too. Nfu-fu-fu!``

TextJPN: 大石さんは何だかとんでもないことを言いながら、カップコーヒーの自動販売機に小銭を入れていた。
TextENG: Ooishi-san put a coin into a vending machine as he said something a bit appalling.

TextJPN: 「アイスティーでいいですか？@k@vS02/11/130700016.　ミルクは入れます？」
TextENG: ``Is iced tea okay with you?@k@vS02/11/130700016. Do you want milk in it?``

TextJPN: 「じゃあ入れますよ？@k@|@y@vS02/11/130700018.　ハイ、どうぞ」
TextENG: ``I'll put some in then, all right?@k@|@y@vS02/11/130700018. Here you are.``

TextJPN: ぽかんとしてる内に、氷がたっぷり入ったアイスティーのカップを渡される。
TextENG: He handed me a cup of tea, filled to the brim with ice, as I looked on absent-mindedly.

TextJPN: …こんなおっさんに、飲み物をおごってもらう義理なんかないはずなのだが…。@kでも…一応、おごられたのでお礼を言っておく。
TextENG: ...I don't think I'm obligated to have a guy like this buy me a drink, but...@k He did get it for me, so I'll thank him.

TextJPN: 大石さんは退屈しのぎなのか、大して縁があるわけでもない俺に、何だかいろいろと下らない話をしてきた。
TextENG: Was Ooishi-san just killing time? We didn't know each other well, but he still engaged me in conversation about all sorts of dumb things.

TextJPN: …本当なら詩音と話をしていたことを思えば、とんだ災難だった…。
TextENG: ...When I thought back to how I talked with Shion, this seemed like a total disaster...

TextJPN: 「前原さんは園崎さんのことをどれくらいご存じで？」
TextENG: ``Maebara-san, how much do you know about Sonozaki-san?``

TextJPN: 「……さっき聞いた以上のことは何も」
TextENG: ``...Other than what I heard just now, nothing.``

TextJPN: 魅音も詩音も、面白いヤツだと言う以上のことはさっきまで何も知らなかった。
TextENG: Until then, I hadn't known anything about either Mion or Shion other than the fact that they were interesting.

TextJPN: 何だか大層な一族のご令嬢だなんてことも、本当に初めて知った。
TextENG: I really did only just learn that she was the daughter of some prestigious family.

TextJPN: 「園崎家はこの地域一帯を牛耳ってる暴力団です。@k@vS02/11/130700021.ちなみに彼女のお父さんは、関東でも有名な暴力団グループの大幹部さんです。@k@vS02/11/130700022.ご存じでした？」
TextENG: ``The Sonozakis are a syndicate with this entire region under their thumb.@k@vS02/11/130700021. Incidentally, her father is a high-ranked executive in a syndicate association that's well known even in the Kanto region.@k@vS02/11/130700022. Did you know that?``

TextJPN: 「詩音さんの自宅をご存じないんですか？@k@vS02/11/130700024.　高い塀に有刺鉄線と監視カメラで守られた、典型的な暴力団の組長宅ですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700025.今度ぜひ遊びに行ってみてください」
TextENG: ``Have you ever seen where Shion-san lives?@k@vS02/11/130700024. It's the very picture of a gang boss's house, protected by high walls, barbed-wire fence, and security cameras.@k@vS02/11/130700025. If you have the chance, you should go and visit her.``

TextJPN: 魅音は跡継ぎだとか言ってたけど……まさか…その暴力団の…？
TextENG: She'd mentioned Mion being a successor...... but... to a crime syndicate...?

TextJPN: 「いえいえいえいえいえ。@k@vS02/11/130700027.まさかまさか。@k@vS02/11/130700028.園崎魅音さんが継ぐのはそんなチンケな暴力団組織だけじゃありません。@k@vS02/11/130700029.彼女が継ぐのは園崎家そのものですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700030.……そのあたりの意味、ちょっと噛み締めていただけますかな？」
TextENG: ``No, no, no, no, no.@k@vS02/11/130700027. Not at all, not at all.@k@vS02/11/130700028. A boring old syndicate isn't the only thing Mion Sonozaki-san will inherit.@k@vS02/11/130700029. She's inheriting the Sonozaki family itself.@k@vS02/11/130700030. ...I'll leave it to you to mull over what exactly that means.``

TextJPN: 大石さんは終始、茶化すような言い方をしていたが、その話の内容は茶化すどころか……にわかには信じられないような話だった。
TextENG: Ooishi-san had spoken lightly about all this from start to finish, but what he was saying wasn't light in the least... it was abrupt and unbelievable.

TextJPN: 「魅音さんがその気になれば、往来の真ん中で人殺しをしたって、もみ消せちゃうかもしれないんですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700032.証人は現れないだろうし、警察にだって圧力をかけられますし」
TextENG: ``If Mion-san wanted to, she could kill someone in the middle of the street and still cover it up.@k@vS02/11/130700032. Not only would witnesses not show up, but she'd put pressure on the police, too.``

TextJPN: 「み、魅音は人殺しなんかしないぞ…！」
TextENG: ``M-Mion would never kill someone...!``

TextJPN: 「なっはっはっは…、しませんしません。もののたとえですよ」
TextENG: ``Na-ha-ha-ha... She wouldn't, she wouldn't. I'm just speaking hypothetically.``

TextJPN: 「…えっと…大石さんでしたっけ？@k@vS02/01/130100321.　名前」
TextENG: ``...Umm... Your name, it was...@k@vS02/01/130100321. Ooishi-san, right?``

TextJPN: 「えぇ、そうです」
TextENG: ``Yes, that's right.``

TextJPN: 「大石さん。@k@vS02/01/130100323.…魅音の家が何だろうと、魅音は俺の誇れる最高の友人です。@k@vS02/01/130100324.それをあまりけなすような言い方は好きになれないですね」
TextENG: ``Then, Ooishi-san.@k@vS02/01/130100323. ...Whatever family Mion comes from, it doesn't change the fact that she's the best friend I could ever have, and I'm proud of that.@k@vS02/01/130100324. I don't appreciate people speaking ill of her.``

TextJPN: 静かな怒りを眼差しに乗せ、睨んでやる。
TextENG: I let my quiet anger show through in my gaze as I stared at him.

TextJPN: …もっともこのつかみ所のない男にはそれが通じたかどうかは怪しい。
TextENG: ...Of course, I could never seem to tell what he's thinking, so I didn't know if it had any effect.

TextJPN: 「ではざっくばらんに。@k@vS02/11/130700036.…その魅音さんに、いくつかの事件の嫌疑がかかっているとしたらどう思います？」
TextENG: ``Then let me be frank.@k@vS02/11/130700036. ...If Mion-san was suspected of a handful of incidents, what would you think?``

TextJPN: 事件の嫌疑？！
TextENG: Suspected? Incidents?!

TextJPN: とんでもないことを言い出すにも…限度がある！
TextENG: You can't just say terrible stuff like that on a whim!

TextJPN: 「何かの誤解に決まってるじゃないですか！@k@vS02/01/130100326.　魅音は物騒なことを言うヤツだけど…そんな、悪いことをするようなヤツじゃない！！」
TextENG: ``Then it would be a misunderstanding, of course!@k@vS02/01/130100326. Mion may say some dangerous things... but she's not the kind of person who would do something so awful!!``

TextJPN: 「前原さん、お静かにお静かに…。@k@vS02/11/130700038.ここ、図書館ですから」
TextENG: ``Maebara-san, keep your voice down...@k@vS02/11/130700038. We're in a library.``

TextJPN: 大石さんがシーっとやるが、俺の昂った興奮は簡単には収まらなかった。
TextENG: Ooshi-san shushed me, but in a state of heightened excitement as I was, I wouldn't be calmed so easily.

TextJPN: 「…落ち着いて下さい。@k@vS02/11/130700040.さっきも申し上げました通り、園崎家は良い意味でも悪い意味でも、この辺り一帯で強い力を持っているんです」
TextENG: ``...Please, calm down.@k@vS02/11/130700040. As I said before, the Sonozaki family holds a lot of power in this region, for better or worse.``

TextJPN: 「ですから、ちょっと何かあるとすぐに疑いがかかってしまう。@k@vS02/11/130700042.…その辺をご理解いただきたいのですよ」
TextENG: ``So if anything happens, they would immediately be suspect.@k@vS02/11/130700042. ...I'd appreciate it if you understood that.``

TextJPN: ……まぁ…大石さんの言いたいことはわかる。
TextENG: ...Well... I know what Ooishi-san is trying to say.

TextJPN: さっきの詩音の話も加味するなら、園崎家は雛見沢から興宮までを牛耳る大一族なのだ。
TextENG: Combining it with what Shion told me before, the Sonozaki family is huge, and controls everything from Hinamizawa to Okinomiya.

TextJPN: そして魅音は、その一族の跡取りで、一族全体に強い影響力を持つらしい。
TextENG: Mion, meanwhile, is its successor, who apparently holds strong influence over the entire family.

TextJPN: だが…だからと言って、魅音を何かの事件で疑うなんて！！
TextENG: Still... that's all? That's the only reason they're suspecting her?!

TextJPN: 「ですから、私だって仕事で仕方なくやってるんです。@k@vS02/11/130700044.魅音さんを疑うためでなく、魅音さんの疑いを晴らすために捜査をしている……そうお考えいただきたいのです」
TextENG: ``I'm just doing my job, here.@k@vS02/11/130700044. Not to doubt Mion-san of anything, but to clear up suspicions surrounding her... Please think of it like that.``

TextJPN: …うまい言い方をする人だなと思った。
TextENG: ...He could talk a dog out of a meat truck.

TextJPN: 汚い大人、狡猾な大人の典型みたいな人だ。
TextENG: He was the definition of a shrewd, unfair adult.

TextJPN: この頃になると、大石さんとの出会いは偶然ではなく、…意図的なものだと気付き始めていた。
TextENG: At this point, I began to think... ...that it was no coincidence I'd met him.

TextJPN: 「……大石さん、ひょっとして俺に用なんですか？」
TextENG: ``...Ooishi-san, do you need something from me?``

TextJPN: 「えぇそうですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700046.前原圭一さん」
TextENG: ``Yes, I do.@k@vS02/11/130700046. Keiichi Maebara-san.``

TextJPN: …あっけらかんとした口調でそう答えた。
TextENG: ...he answered in an absent tone of voice.

TextJPN: 「…何かの事件で魅音を疑っていて、その友人の俺に何か聞きに来た。@k@vS02/01/130100329.…そういうことですか？」
TextENG: ``...Mion's being suspected of something, and you came to hear from a friend of hers: me.@k@vS02/01/130100329. ...Is that it?``

TextJPN: 「いえいえ、違います。@k@vS02/11/130700048.私は園崎魅音さんの友人と話をしにきたのではなく、前原圭一さんに話をしにきたのです。@k@vS02/11/130700049.ご自宅にお伺いしたらご迷惑でしたでしょうからね」
TextENG: ``No, no, that isn't it.@k@vS02/11/130700048. I didn't come to talk to a friend of Mion Sonozaki-san. I came here to talk to Keiichi Maebara-san.@k@vS02/11/130700049. It would probably have bothered you had I visited your house.``

TextJPN: 「俺に……？@k@vS02/01/130100331.　警察が何の用だって言うんですか…？」
TextENG: ``To me...?@k@vS02/01/130100331. What do the police want with me...?``

TextJPN: この偶然を装ったコンタクトが、俺個人を狙い撃ちしたものだとわかり、急に気味が悪くなる。
TextENG: Having realized this faked coincidental meeting had me as its target, my mood immediately turned foul.

TextJPN: 「なっはっはっは。@k@vS02/11/130700051.そんなに構えなくて大丈夫ですよ。@k@vS02/11/130700052.肩を楽にして、ちょっと質問に答えてくださるだけでいいんです」
TextENG: ``Na-ha-ha-ha.@k@vS02/11/130700051. You don't need to be so tense.@k@vS02/11/130700052. Calm down, and just answer a few questions.``

TextJPN: 「それって…職務質問ってヤツですか…？」
TextENG: ``Am I... being questioned...?``

TextJPN: 「偶然知り合ったオジサンとの世間話ってことにしましょう。んっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``Let's call it a chat with a guy you happened to run into. Nfu-fu-fu-fu!``

TextJPN: 大石さんはリラックスしたムードを演出しようと、砕けた言い方をする。
TextENG: Ooishi-san freely suggested that I relax.

TextJPN: …だが、瞳の奥に見え隠れする光には鷹のような鋭さが宿っていた。
TextENG: ...That said, behind his eyes was a light, which I could only see sometimes, that was sharp as a hawk.

TextJPN: この場を無理に逃げ出そうとすれば、このおっさんは本当に俺を連行して取調室みたいなところへ連れて行くかもしれない。@k……それはたまらなく嫌な想像だった。
TextENG: If I tried in vain to run away, he might actually take me in and bring me to an interrogation room or something.@k ...That was an undoubtedly unpleasant thought.

TextJPN: 「…昨夜は綿流しのお祭り、盛大で楽しかったですねぇ」
TextENG: ``...You had a roaring good time at the Watanagashi Festival last night, didn't you?``

TextJPN: 「はぐらかさないで下さい…！@k@vS02/01/130100334.　今さら世間話なんかされても…、」
TextENG: ``Don't beat around the bush, please...!@k@vS02/01/130100334. I can't do small talk right now...``

TextJPN: 「昨日の綿流しの晩」
TextENG: ``Last night, during the festival.``

TextJPN: 「…富竹ジロウさんと鷹野三四さんにお会いしませんでしたか？」
TextENG: ``...Did you see Jirou Tomitake-san and Miyo Takano-san?``

TextJPN: ……ぎくり。
体がびくりと震えるのが、自分でもよくわかった。
TextENG: I could plainly feel myself give a start.

TextJPN: 「あれ……写真はどこにいっちゃったかな。@k@vS02/11/130700058.…あぁ。@k@vS02/11/130700059.あったあった」
TextENG: ``Hmm? ...Where did I put those pictures?@k@vS02/11/130700058. ...Oh.@k@vS02/11/130700059. Here they are.``

TextJPN: 手帳を開き、２枚の写真を出す。@k…見るまでもなかった。
TextENG: He opened a small notebook and removed two photographs.@k ...I didn't have to look.
``I... Well...@k@vS02/01/130100336. Who knows?@k@vS02/01/130100337. I might have seen them around, I don't remember...``

TextJPN: 今日、これと同じ質問を二度受ける。@k…そして俺は、二度目もまた同じ答えを口にした。
TextENG: I was asked the same question for the second time today.@k ...I gave the same answer for the second time, too.

TextJPN: 「あれ。記憶が曖昧ですか？@k@vS02/11/130700061.　まさかアルコールが入っててよく覚えてないなんてのはナシにして下さいよ。んっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``Hm? Your memories are blurry?@k@vS02/11/130700061. You couldn't have possibly been drinking or anything? Nfu-fu-fu-fu!``

TextJPN: これもまた……魅音に質問された時と同様。@k…俺の曖昧な答えを、不快に思っているのがよくわかった…。
TextENG: Here, too... I got the same answer as I had from Mion.@k ...I realized he wasn't taking my vague reply well...

TextJPN: どうして…魅音と同じことを…俺に聞くんだ…？
TextENG: Why... is he asking me... the same thing Mion did...?

TextJPN: 詩音とお喋りすることで、忘れかけていた今日一日の暗い気持ちが一気にぶり返す。
TextENG: The dark feelings I had nearly forgotten due to my conversation with Shion came rushing back in a hurry.

TextJPN: ……神聖な祭具殿に忍び込んだ、バチ当たりな行為。
TextENG: ......We snuck into the sacred ritual storehouse—a punishable act.

TextJPN: …それはちょっとした出来心で…、今さらだが…反省しているつもり……。
TextENG: ...It was on a tiny impulse... While it may not count for much now... I do feel sorry about it...

TextJPN: 「もう一度、お聞きしますよ。@k@vS02/11/130700063.…昨夜のお祭りで、富竹ジロウさんと鷹野三四さんにお会いしませんでしたか？」
TextENG: ``I'll ask you again.@k@vS02/11/130700063. ...Did you see Jirou Tomitake-san and Miyo Takano-san at the festival last night?``

TextJPN: 口調は穏やかだったが…、明らかにさっきとは違う、凄みが込められていた。@k……怖い。@k率直にそう思った…。
TextENG: His tone was soft... but there was a dreadfulness in his voice, clearly different from the first time he asked.@k ......I'm scared.@k That was exactly how I felt...

TextJPN: 「…っと…、繰り返し聞かれても……こ、答えはさっきと同じ、です……」
TextENG: ``...Er... Even if you repeat the question... m-my answer won't change...``

TextJPN: よく覚えていない。
TextENG: I don't really remember.

TextJPN: …これほど都合のいい答えはほかにない。
TextENG: ...There wasn't any better answer I could give him.

TextJPN: …会わなかったとウソをつく勇気もないし、…会ったと認められる勇気もまたなかった…。
TextENG: I didn't have the balls to say I didn't see them... nor the courage to admit I had.

TextJPN: 「そうですか。@k@vS02/11/130700065.……改めて聞けば、さっきとは違う答えが返ってくるかなぁと思いましてね」
TextENG: ``I see.@k@vS02/11/130700065. ...I just thought that maybe I'd get a different answer if I asked a second time.``

TextJPN: もう怖くて…大石さんの目を見ることもできなかった。
TextENG: I'm too scared... to look Ooishi-san in the eyes.

TextJPN: 「では質問を変えます」
TextENG: ``I'll change the question.``

TextJPN: 「…ほら、前原さん。@k@vS02/11/130700068.リラックスリラックス」
TextENG: ``...Come, Maebara-san.@k@vS02/11/130700068. Relax, relax.``

TextJPN: 大石さんが、肩を掴んでぐいぐいと揉むように力をかけてくる。@k…痛いだけだった。
TextENG: Ooishi-san grabbed my shoulders and squeezed them, as if trying to give me a massage.@k ...It mostly just hurt, though.

TextJPN: しかし………どうして…魅音と同じことを聞くのだろう。
TextENG: Still...... why... would he ask the same things as Mion?

TextJPN: ……魅音とまったく同じことをまだ聞いてくるなら、次の質問はきっと…、
TextENG: ...If he's asking the same things, then the next question must be...

TextJPN: 「同じく昨夜のお祭りなんですが、園崎詩音さんにお会いしませんでしたか？」
TextENG: ``On the same night of the festival, did you see Shion Sonozaki-san?``

TextJPN: ………カラカラカラ。
TextENG: ......*clatter* *clatter* *clatter*

TextJPN: …何の音かと見下ろすと、俺が両手で握り締めているカップの中の溶け残った氷が音を立てていた。
TextENG: ...I wondered what that sound was, and when I looked down, I saw that it was the unmelted ice in the cup I was gripping in my hands.

TextJPN: …震える両手が、氷を揺らして音を立てているのだ。
TextENG: ...My hands were trembling, rocking the ice back and forth.

TextJPN: …それに気付き、慌てて残った氷を口に入れ、ガリガリと噛み砕く。
TextENG: ...Realizing that, I hastily put the remaining ice in my mouth and crunched down on it.

TextJPN: 「……す……すみません……。@k@vS02/01/130100340.会ったかもしれないですけど……ほら…、魅音にもそっくりですから…。@k@vS02/01/130100341.……魅音と見間違えてるかも……」
TextENG: ``...S... Sorry...@k@vS02/01/130100340. I may have seen her... but... well, you know, she looks just like Mion...@k@vS02/01/130100341. ...I might have just mistaken the two...``

TextJPN: 「なっはっはっは。@k@vS02/11/130700071.…そんなわけはないでしょう？」
TextENG: ``Na-ha-ha-ha.@k@vS02/11/130700071. ...But that can't be.``

TextJPN: 突然、大石さんは俺の両肩をぐっと掴むと、目が合うようにわざわざ屈みこんできた。
TextENG: Suddenly, Ooishi-san grabbed both my shoulders and hunched down to give me a level stare.

TextJPN: …ヘビに睨まれたカエルというのは…こういうものなのか。
TextENG: ...This must be what it's like... to be a deer in the headlights.

TextJPN: 目線を逸らしたいのに…逸らせない……。
TextENG: I want to look away... but I can't...

TextJPN: 射抜く眼光というものを…生まれて初めて経験する…。
TextENG: This is the first time I've experienced... such a piercing stare...

TextJPN: 「魅音さんも詩音さんも、服装は全然、違うんですから。@k@vS02/11/130700073.そう簡単に見間違えるはずはありませんよ？@k@vS02/11/130700074.　前原さん」
TextENG: ``Mion-san and Shion-san wear completely different clothing.@k@vS02/11/130700073. You wouldn't mistake the two so easily, I would think.@k@vS02/11/130700074. Maebara-san.``

TextJPN: 口調が厳しかった。@k……魅音にされたのと同じように、厳しかった。
TextENG: His voice was harsh.@k ...Harsh, the same as when Mion said it.

TextJPN: 自分の動悸が激しくなるのがわかる。
TextENG: I could feel my heartbeat quickening.

TextJPN: …それが肩を掴んだ手に伝って、感じ取られているのがわかり、さらに恐ろしかった。
TextENG: ...When I realized he could feel it through the hands on my shoulders, I got even more scared.

TextJPN: …どうして…どうして、魅音も大石さんも…昨夜のことを聞くんだ…？
TextENG: ...Why... why are Mion and Ooishi-san... both asking about last night...?

TextJPN: 祭具殿に忍び込んだことが……そんなにも……、………ぅ…………。
TextENG: Was sneaking into that storehouse so... bad...... urgh.........

TextJPN: …鷹野さんの口車になんか乗せられなければよかった。
TextENG: ...I shouldn't have let Takano-san talk me into it.

TextJPN: 富竹さんが見てきなよ、なんて気さくに言うから…つい。
TextENG: Tomitake-san casually said to check it out, too... so...

TextJPN: ……詩音だって…俺に勧めなければ……。
TextENG: ...Even Shion... If she hadn't encouraged me...

TextJPN: いや、…わかってる。
TextENG: No... I understood.

TextJPN: 一番悪いのは自分自身だった。
TextENG: I was the one most at fault here.

TextJPN: ……変な好奇心なんかに負けず、禁断の祭具殿に入らなければよかったんだ……。
TextENG: I shouldn't have let my curiosity get the better of me. I shouldn't have gone into the forbidden storehouse...
``Ooishi-san.@k@vS02/19/133100002. I think that's our cue to get out of here.``

TextJPN: 休憩コーナーに、スーツの若い男性が入ってきた。
TextENG: A young man wearing a suit came into the lounge.

TextJPN: …雰囲気から、大石さんの部下か何かだとすぐわかる。
TextENG: ...From the way he held himself, I knew immediately that he was Ooishi-san's subordinate.

TextJPN: 「ん？　ありゃあ、本当だ。@k@vS02/11/130700076.もう閉館なんですねぇ」
TextENG: ``Hm? Oh, so it is.@k@vS02/11/130700076. Closing time already?``

TextJPN: 言われるまで気付かなかった。
TextENG: I hadn't realized it until he said something.

TextJPN: …いつの間にか、閉館を知らせる音楽とアナウンスが流れていた。
TextENG: ...The jingle and announcement telling patrons the library had closed had started playing without me realizing it.

TextJPN: …そんなのも耳に入らないくらい、焦燥しきり、打ちのめされていた。
TextENG: ...I was so irritated, so overwhelmed, that I couldn't even hear it.

TextJPN: 「じゃあ前原くん。@k@vS02/11/130700078.もうこんな時間なんで、私たちは失礼させてもらいます。@k@vS02/11/130700079.このお話は、もっと時間のある時に、のんびりといたしましょう」
TextENG: ``Well then, Maebara-kun.@k@vS02/11/130700078. We're out of time, so allow me to take my leave.@k@vS02/11/130700079. I'd like to talk with you more about this at your leisure, when we have more time.``

TextJPN: ……冗談じゃない。@k金輪際にしてほしかった…。
TextENG: ...This isn't a joke.@k If I never saw him again, it would be too soon...

TextJPN: 大石さんは、部下を伴うと、休憩コーナーを後にした。@k……と思った矢先に、ぐるっと振り返る。
TextENG: Ooishi-san followed his subordinate and left the lounge behind him.@k ...However, he spun back around.

TextJPN: 「そうそう前原さん」
TextENG: ``Oh, right, Maebara-san.``

TextJPN: 「…な、……何ですか…」
「さっきさせてもらった２つの質問ですが。@k@vS02/11/130700082.…どちらの回答も、よく覚えてない、でしたよね？」
TextENG: ``Those two questions I asked you before.@k@vS02/11/130700082. ...You don't remember well enough to answer either of them, correct?``

TextJPN: 「参考までに。@k@vS02/11/130700084.…あなた、昨日、全員にお会いしてますよ。@k@vS02/11/130700085.４人で楽しそうに歩いてたじゃないですか。@k@vS02/11/130700086.……石段のところで。@k@vS02/11/130700087.私がこの目で見てますから」
TextENG: ``Just so you know...@k@vS02/11/130700084. ...You saw them all yesterday.@k@vS02/11/130700085. You were walking along, the four of you, having quite a pleasant time.@k@vS02/11/130700086. ...Near the stone steps.@k@vS02/11/130700087. I saw you with my own eyes.``

TextJPN: …息が詰まって、心臓が止まりかける。
TextENG: ...I caught my breath, and my heart seemed like it was about to stop.

TextJPN: ……何て嫌らしい男なんだ。
TextENG: ...What a detestable person.

TextJPN: …この男は…知ってて…俺を試したのか…。
TextENG: ...He... he knew... and he was testing me...

TextJPN: 「ではまたお会いしましょう。@k@vS02/11/130700089.よいお年を」
TextENG: ``We'll meet again.@k@vS02/11/130700089. Have a good year.``

TextJPN: カツカツという、革靴の踵が鳴らす音が完全に聞こえなくなるまで…俺は石のように、動くことはできなかった…。
TextENG: I sat there like a rock, unmoving... until I could no longer hear the clacking sounds of their footsteps...
